abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Social Development
            Fund Project is rated as highly satisfactory, sustainability
            as likely, institutional development impact as substantial,
            Bank performance as highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance as highly satisfactory. Some key lessons learned
            from this project include: 1) Poor communities can go beyond
            needs identification and participation in problem solving
            and there is a high potential for civic engagement. 2) There
            is increasing evidence that the bottom-up approach is
            beneficial for sensitizing authorities to community-drive
            development (CDD). 3) People from graduating villages have
            turned out to be the best facilitators and promoters. 4)
            Communities that receive Romanian Social Development Fund
            (RSDF) grants want to communicate, share experience and
            organize themselves in a network that will promote CDD in
            Romania. 4) There is a wealth of poverty-related data at
            RSDF level which needs to be analyzed and included in
            studies. Findings of such analyzes need to be disseminated.
            5) The RSDF has to make sure its control procedures do not
            turn into bureaucracy.

5083471.trustfund: TF025356-PHRD-SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT FUND (BANK-EXECUTED),TF027128-PHRD-SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT FUND PROJECT
5083471.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Social
            Development Fund Project is to improve the livelihood of
            project beneficiaries in poor rural communities, and
            increase social capital at the local organizational level.
            The project consists of two main components: 1) Financing
            sub-projects prepared by recipients in poor rural
            communities, and disadvantaged groups. This includes the
            rehabilitation, upgrading, building or furnishing of small
            rural infrastructures; the development of community-based
            social services; and, income generating activities.
            Furthermore, training and technical assistance will be
            provided for building a community capacity, able to
            participate, identify, and prioritize their own needs,
            towards the design, implementation, and monitoring of
            sub-projects. In addition, cost-effectiveness standards will
            be maintained and appropriate technologies will be provided
            to support small infrastructures. 2) Strengthening the
            institutional capacity of the Social Development Fund and
            supporting the overall management of the project. The
            project will support poverty alleviation at the community
            level through an increased cooperation in resource
            mobilization and problem solving.
